Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2006023399.CaseDesc: John Allen Bowes was last seen in Nipigon, Ontario getting gasoline on August 15, 1992. He was travelling eastbound toward his home in Kingston, Ontario. Mr. Bowes usually wears a baseball cap.

Case reference: 2014046775.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2014, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Sofia Touila was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sofia had told her friend that she would be going home but did not return.

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2012020158.CaseDesc: This adult male was witnessed collapsing in the 400 block of Powell Street in East Vancouver. He was pronounced dead upon arrival to hospital.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim
Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back

Case reference: 2014005610.CaseDesc: Roman Drag was last seen in the early hours of May 23, 2011 fishing at the top of the Bassano Dam in Bassano, AB. Roman and a friend were night fishing on the shore of the Bow River. His black jacket and fishing gear were found in the place where he was last seen. Search teams located a pair of glasses but were not able to locate Roman.

Case reference: 2006006899.CaseDesc: Ruth Jackson is an Alzheimer's patient, who was travelling in a car with her husband, who is also an Alzheimer's patient.  At some point, Mrs. Jackson got out of their vehicle and her husband drove off. He cannot recall where he left his wife. They were last seen together in the Elm Tree Road area of Kaladar.  An extensive air and ground search was conducted with negative results. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.

Case reference: 2018005318.CaseDesc: In November 2016 Fereydoun Taleshpour Bandari left his apartment in the Carlton Street and Church Street area of Toronto, to travel.  It is believed Mr. Taleshpour Bandari was sick at the time he left his home.  All of his belongings were left in the apartment and his family cannot account for his whereabouts.

Hair: Black, Short, Straight, Black moustache and beard

Case reference: 2014006229.CaseDesc: In 1981, Cyril Thistle was seen for the last time when he was out on day parole and visiting his sister.  There is reason to believe that Mr. Thistle lived a transient lifestyle as he was known in Toronto, Ontario and on the west coast of Canada.

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2018040305.CaseDesc: On the morning of April 10, 2001, Joo Youn was seen for the last time as she sent her children off to school in Toronto, Ontario. Later that day, when Joo’s husband returned home she was gone and she had left a note.

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2014004976.CaseDesc: Beric Bason was last seen on July 22, 2007 at Loon Lake Resort near Clinton, British Columbia.  Beric has not been seen or heard from since and the reason for his disappearance is unknown.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm, Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2013000111.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1954, Clifford Edward Sherwood Thorne was seen for the last time at the family residence in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Clifford left home to go to school and was never seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2020008550.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1984, Anita Tamboom was seen for the last time by her neighbour in Toronto, Ontario. Anita was known to frequently leave her home for extended periods, but she would always return. During the time of her disappearance, Anita was suffering from some mental health issues, and her purse was located on the shores of Lake Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2016034844.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2016, Derwin Beardy was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Derwin was leading a transient lifestyle.

Shirt: Cotton, Red, White, Red t-shirt with white lettering across back, white emblem left chest

Case reference: 2011002399.CaseDesc: Cynthia Sunga was last seen at her family home on Donald street, on or about August 25, 2005.  She was reported missing to the Ottawa Police on November 11, 2005, by a family member.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Molar number 16 Upper missing, removed in 2000. The records of the bordering teeth available.
Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal heart - Chinese characters for strong

Case reference: 2019009156.CaseDesc: Yves Guérin was last seen in January 1991, when he left his residence in Montréal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 2022001264.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2022, Ian Indridson was seen for the last time at his residence in Victoria, British Columbia.  Ian has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Blue, Eddie Bauer Brand, waffle knit, black or blue

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2014001445.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1992, Howard Scott was last seen in Calgary, Alberta. Howard was travelling in his red 1985 Ford LTD Station Wagon from Calgary and was destined to return to Richmond, British Columbia. On August 15, 1992, Howard’s abandoned vehicle was located in a heavily wooded logging road near Moyie, British Columbia.  Howard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014002689.CaseDesc: Karel Szabo was last heard from in April or May of 1985, when he sent his mother, who lived in Czechoslovakia, a postcard from Los Angeles, California. Karel had written about his travels to Las Vegas and San Francisco. In November 1984, Karel had informed his family that he was going to Barrie, Ontario, to get a trucking job; when in fact he travelled to the United States.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Jaw, Lower right side jaw broken in 1982.
Scar: Waist, Dime sized surgical scar near the bellybutton.

Case reference: 2022006239.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1990, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Vincent Stack was seen for the last time by his family members leaving his residence in Buffalo, New York. Vincent’s vehicle was located abandon in a parking lot near Niagara Falls State Park in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Van had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2008015999.CaseDesc: John Zuern was 21 years old when he went missing from the London Psychiatric Hospital in London, Ontario on June 14, 1975.  He did not return to his family home in Guelph, Ontario, and was reported missing by his family. He had been diagnosed as schizophrenic, and he walks with a pronounced limp.  Mr. Zuern's brother reported seeing him in the Bloor & Spadina area of Toronto during the summer of 1980.  He was believed to have been living on the streets at that time.

Hair: Grey, Long, Unkempt; unkempt Beard, Moustache
Deformity: leg, walks with a pronounced limp

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014006268.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Brandon Jakobek was seen for the last time flying a plane from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. Brandon, a Morningstar Air pilot and avid skydiver, had flown in from Toronto to deliver parcels for FedEx. He had informed employees prior to his departure that a warning light had illuminated during his flight and that he needed to run some diagnostic checks. The plane was never found and is thought to be in the Hudson Bay.

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2022010303.CaseDesc: On January 6, 2022, Jeannine Ermineskin was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta’s downtown area.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Love, eagle, feather, lady with headdress
Right Upper Arm, Crown, diamond, flower, stars  and feathers
Left Upper Arm, Eagle, female face and a rose
Right Hand, The word "LOVE" on knuckles
Right Side Of Neck, Cursive text "Daniel"

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2022005356.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2021, Krystine Scott was seen for the last time in Windsor, Ontario. Krystine is known to lead a transient lifestyle, but it is not in her nature to be out of contact with her friends and family for an extended period.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2018046096.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2018, Victor Falk was seen for the last time after being dropped off at his residence in Rosthern, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Victor suffered from Alzheimer's disease.

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001985.CaseDesc: Odette Richard was last seen on February 25, 1990 at approximately 6:30 p.m., when she went for a walk from her home in Laval, Quebec. Odette has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Other, Full, upper and lower dentures
Deformity: Right Foot, Bone bump, top of foot

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2017013186.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2017, Cameron Duffy was seen for the last time near the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Hood trimmed with fur
